creator.name: Tweede kamer der Staten-Generaal
creator.his_func:
Legislation and monitoring of government policy were considered the main tasks of the States-General. Since 1815 the States-General has consisted of two chambers, the First Chamber or "House of Lords" and the Second Chamber or "House of Commons".
According to the Constitution of 1848, the States-General were involved in colonial policy, and the government had to make a comprehensive annual report, a "Koloniaal Verslag". These colonial reports are attachments of the "Handelingen" (Proceedings), the report of the plenary and public sessions of the States-General.
creator.notes: See also 'Staten-Generaal Digitaal. Parlementaire documenten uit de periode 1814 tot 1995', available on the Koninklijke Bibliotheek (KB) website, Catalogi & Digitale collecties.
